config.24-hours.title: 24 Hours MOD Configuration
config.24-hours.enabled.tooltip: When enabled, Minecraft time will sync with real world time (24 hours per day instead of 20 minutes)
config.24-hours.timeMode.tooltip: Choose which time mode to use. Only one mode is active at a time.
config.24-hours.manual.description: Set the exact time when the game starts. The game will begin at this specified time and only seconds will progress. Independent of timezone.
Set what hour the game starts at (0-23). Default is 19 (7:00 PM).
Example: if set to 19, the game will start at 19:00 (7:00 PM) and stay there.
config.24-hours.manualStartMinute.toolti: Set what minute the game starts at (0-59). Example: Hour=19, Minute=30 means game starts at 19:30 (7:30 PM).
config.24-hours.country.description: Use country timezone to automatically sync with real time in the selected country. This ignores the manual start hour setting.
config.24-hours.selectedCountry.tooltip: Choose a country to sync time with its timezone. Select from dropdown list.
config.24-hours.clockFormat.tooltip: Choose between 24-hour format (00:00-23:59) or 12-hour format with AM/PM (12:00 AM - 11:59 PM)
config.24-hours.clockX.tooltip: Horizontal position of the clock on screen
config.24-hours.clockY.tooltip: Vertical position of the clock on screen
config.24-hours.showBackground.tooltip: Display a background behind the clock for better visibility
commands.24hours.mode.manual: Time mode set to Manual Start Hour
commands.24hours.mode.country: Time mode set to Country Timezone
